page.title: 05Farming: Specimen Farm
page.content: Trewaters Farm, on junction of 1,2,5 and 6 consists of 130 acres (approximately 22 acres being scrub-type woodland) owned jointly by the Farmer and his uncle. The farmhouse is used for letting purposes. The modern bunglow (1) is owned by one of the Farmers employees. There are a number of farm Buildings viz- Old-type cattle sheds, a new shed to hold 100 calves, a dutch barn, a grain bin with 100 tons capacity, and a shed for the combine harvester and other machinery. The farmer keeps about 140 calves on set stocking plan and 100 ewes and lambs each year. 60 acres are in corn. Three full-time men are employed to work with the farmer on a total of 430 acres (two other farms with this one) and all modern machinery is used. A spring supplies the farm and bungalows water.
